snippet.textDisplay:
The best pure "JRPG " since at least It's 2007 release , and one of the greatest of all time for lore. Of all the sequels they make to ho hum garbage nobody ever asked them to , 
why couldn't  Microsoft and Mistwalker see this was their biggest most promising chance for a new JRPG IP , which didn't look or feel like an average 
stereotypical anime? or like a bad 3D attempt with no original depth In story , but one which blended oldschool with new In a unique epic fashion.. and did It authentically 
without feeling antiquated graphically? This was the natural progression of FFX and exactly where the FF series should've gone.

In other words this dosen't feel like " throwback " bs that only reminds you of the glory days of Square. Backstory Is all time worthy. The music Is 90's classic soundtrack level. 
Microsoft will never be a serious global threat If they can't compete In japan Imo , and japan will never accept Microsoft unless they truly change the stereotypes
of their console's target market , and make big budget JRPG exclusives. THEY'RE STILL VIABLE . Mistwalker tried AND succeeded here. Dropping support because It didn't sell over million on a FPS-centric system sucks , and shows alot of ppl In charge simply don't know what's up or look at the long-term potential of cult-status games like this
when viewed among their own similar products of same genre. Not compared to sales or acclaim to everything else. They should re-investigate 
older games modern potential by studying It's reverence to compare. They might then see how much It's notoriety had time to grow and foster. LO deserves a second chance.

Square never made a sequel to Chrono Cross or a dozen other obvious cash cows that just need the next number In the title... must not like ALOT more money!.
The Industry Is no longer developed or marketed by a gamers creator anymore ( except CDprojekt RED , and Fromsoftware etc ). 
Everytime I cross the newer IGN or Gamespot staff over the past 10 years I can clearly see that.  People nowdays force whatever games they want to to be big and sale , once the marketing and Investment becomes too big to fail. #Brainwashing

snippet.textDisplay: I'm glad you said that, because this piece evokes images of some mysterious path through the woods where the sunlight shining through the trees and birds singing their sweet songs creates a fantasy-like setting where you would expect to find a some holy ascetic guru who'd tell you the secrets of the universe, or a piece of rare materia if you were in the world of Final Fantasy 7.
